perturbation.changed_text:
Article 2
"Affiliate" means, in relation to Party A, any enterprise or other entity which,
directly or indirectly, controls, or is controlled by, Party A; the term
"control" meaning ownership of thirty percent (30%) or more of the registered
capital or voting stock or the power to appoint the general manager, factory
chief or other principal person in charge of an enterprise or other entity.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the definition of 'control' from 50% to 30% ownership creates a contradiction, as other sections might rely on the 50% threshold for determining Affiliate status. This leads to uncertainty in contractual obligations related to Affiliates.

Article 96

perturbation.explanation: Changing 'two years' to 'ten years' after termination for confidentiality obligations introduces a contradiction. Enforcing a 10-year confidentiality period instead of the original two may cause disputes, affecting the Parties' ability to operate independently post-termination. This also conflicts with international commercial practice because confidentiality agreements generally last 2-5 years.
